STBLKeyStringList.Text: Last year, Christopher surprised me with a his-and-hers gaming setup for our house. I love gaming with him—though I am definitely mega-competitive.
Have you been to Gilbert Gardens yet? The gazebo is my favorite part; my spouse, Christopher, proposed to me right in front of it!

My son, Atlas, has been talking over and over about how he wants to learn how to ride a bike. I can't wait to teach him, but I can't help but remember some of the times I had trouble learning myself as a kid.
Doli Ruano and I have been friends for a while. Just because she's mega-goth doesn't mean she's out of touch with fashion, and she's always the first one I go to for style tips.
I used to live by myself in Anchorpoint Wharf for a while, but I have to be honest and say that I like it out here in Hopewell Hills. It's a nice, calm place to raise my kids.

It's pretty out here but I hear there used to be a lot more trees in the whole area. I guess when they were developing things, they cut down a lot of them. I'm a tech-y person so trust me, I love all the latest gadgets, but sometimes you do wonder what we're losing when we're racing forward all the time.

This is way more gossip-y than I like to get, but did you know Xochitl Luna's husband died while cooking Gummy Bear Pancakes? Xochitl is just so nice; we've all felt just awful about it since it happened.

It's not a secret, but I still prefer not to talk about it with people I don't know as well. I came out as trans just before we adopted Atlas. I'd been thinking about it for a long time but hadn't said anything to anyone until I blurted it out to my friend, Doli, and she just said: if you feel like you are, maybe you should embrace the idea that you are a woman. I already knew in my heart who I really was, but that early support from her and from my husband meant everything.

When Christopher and I got married, we went to Tartosa—I'm old acquaintances with Camille Soto, do you know her? Anyway, we had a galaxy-themed cake at our wedding because, well, I'm kind of into astronomy, if that wasn't obvious!
I started losing my teeth as a child before Atlas did; it's interesting to see how much that varies person-to-person. I was so excited to get that money from the tooth fairy, though!

They added a little splashpad to the park not all that long ago. Believe it or not, the person we have to thank for that one is Ignacio Robles. He gets really involved in city business, and he kept saying there aren't enough things for kids with families to do around here, so he wanted that built up. It was so sweet of him. Atlas loves it there!

Atlas was such a quiet baby that I guess I expected Orion to be the same, but I guess things really do vary one child to the next. When Orion's awake, she's interested in everything and anything and does not want to sit still or be ignored. Keeping an eye on her is a full time job.
There are some really nice walking paths up in Gilbert Gardens; look for the signs and you'll be able to powerwalk around out there. Just keep an eye out for Whiteclaw the alligator!
Why do you think they call that neighborhood "Hopewell Hills" anyway? Sounds eerily upbeat. There's a really old tree stump out there—Ol' Stumpy. You should pay Stumpy a visit.
You know that clown painting over at the Recreation Center? Pretty sure it's haunted. No, not pretty sure. DEFINITELY sure!
That movie theater out on Anchorpoint Wharf has a massive selection. It seems like there's always a movie playing that'll suit your favorite genre!
They keep the splash pad turned on even when it's cold or rainy, so maybe think twice before taking the kids there on a cold day.
How many planets are in the universe? How many in ever, forever? Do you know the name of our planet? Also, do you know what a comet is?

I go to school with Karmine Luna. My mom wants me to be friends with her, but she likes really different stuff. She likes animals and making drawings and she thinks it's boring when I want to to play in the treehouse with her.
You know how cool my dad is? He helped work on a super-cool treehouse with me! I love it when dad wants to spend time doing something special with me.
I'm working hard on not being bossy. Mom and dad say that's really important. But it bugs me when other kids don't listen to me.
I know something sad about Karmine's dad, but I'm not supposed to talk about it. I never would, either. That'd be wrong.

When I'm all grown up I want to do something really cool like be an astronaut. My mom says I'm sorta destined for it, even. But she says to be an astronaut you have to be really good at science. Is that hard?
Mom is friends with that Doli lady, and sometimes Doli and Jay bring over their kid Tala. Tala is kind of a baby to me though. She cries a lot.
Orange and purple go together, right? Right? I'm trying to match my leggings with a new sweater, and I just can't make up my mind. I have to look amazing or I'll ruin my rep!

I was at the movies with my friends a couple weeks ago watching The Great Pickle Capers—awesome film, by the way—and guess what happens out of absolutely nowhere? A frog shows up. Explain to me how there are frogs in a movie theater? So weird, dude.
I bet I don't look too athletic to you, but I actually really love swimming. I prioritize music a bit, but I still like getting plenty of exercise.

Last week I completely bombed a test. Like, just absolutely got wrecked. I felt really embarrassed, but my grandpa made me breakfast for dinner and told me about this one time when he got in trouble for looking at a classmate's paper during an exam.

Jay's really cool. They're a bit clumsy sometimes and a little silly, but I kind of like that contrast to my mom since she's always super-neat and organized. Those two have an interesting dynamic together. I can tell that they don't always get along as well as they pretend to, though.

My high school classmates talk about dating a lot, but I have to be real: I'm not that interested in dating. I like being around people, I care about folks a lot, but I don't always have really strong romantic feelings. Kinda ever. But I know that's not THAT unusual, and in my family we're raised to be proud of who we are. So I am! I'm proud of being not-super-into-romance!

Sometimes I feel a lot of pressure to be good at stuff all the time. I got really burned out on violin, and I wonder if I'm disappointing my grandpa by not playing. Sometimes I worry I'm about to let my grades slip, too, and I can't afford that. I have too many things I want to do in my life and I can't afford to fail.

Don't tell anyone, but sometimes I sneak out at night to go swimming in the lake. Don't worry, it's safe out there and I always tell a friend where I am. But it's so peaceful being out there when the moon's shining on the water.

Being a big brother is a huge deal to me, and I really want to be someone a little sibling can look up to. My mom's been worried that it might mean I try to take too many things on, but that's what siblings are for: being there for each other no matter what.

My dad's such a great writer. When I was little, we'd camp out in the backyard sometimes and when I was half-asleep in my sleeping bag, he'd come up with these super elaborate bedtime stories about this whole vampire family. Maybe not very kid appropriate, but I thought it was loads of fun.

Everyone else in my family has an anchor tattoo to show that they're a Robles. My dad was so excited to join the family that he took my mom's last name, even! When I'm old enough, he and I are gonna go and get anchor tattoos together.
My mom's friends with Xochitl Luna, and a few years ago she taught me an important lesson: if you're not coordinating your nails with your outfit, are you even living?

When I was pregnant with Aurelio, being good at fishing served me well; all I had to do was pop by the park and I could catch whatever I needed to have Ignacio whip up fish and chips for me that night.
It gets pretty stormy here sometimes, but I always like to look on the bright side: more rain means better fishing for me!

I'm so proud of Aurelio, but I wish he'd ease up a little bit sometimes. He's always so worried about doing everything right and never making any mistakes, but he's a teenager: you're allowed to make some mistakes in order to grow.
Xochitl and I went to school together and we've been friendly ever since. It's hard to imagine now, but did you know that she dated Christopher Michaelson once? Seems like it was a lifetime ago.

Living this close to the park definitely has its advantages. Aurelio used to go to lock-in slumber parties at the Rec Center all the time, and I loved being able to take him for walks around the park when he was just a toddler. I wonder if I can get away with bringing the new baby out to fish at the lake with me?

Ian was let go from his job once, and it was a huge blow to his self-esteem. I wish he understood that sometimes your job just isn't a good fit and it doesn't make him a bad person, but I guess those value judgements are kinda built in for us sometimes, huh?

Jay and I were so close when we were kids, and I don't really understand what happened. I think sometimes I'm a bit too hard on them. I offered some parenting advice once and, well, it went poorly. I know it's on me to fix things, but it's really hard to admit when you're wrong. I'll try harder.

I hear Ignacio wants to raise money to get a karaoke machine at the Rec Center. More power to him, but something like that in the hands of a lot of people in our community seems a bit dangerous for the eardrums.

I suppose at this point it's almost a cliche, but just because I'm pretty serious about my career in business doesn't mean I'm not capable of unwinding. I think it's important to look on the light side of things as much as you can.
I didn't have a baby shower when I first had Aurelio, and I really feel like I missed out. It's nice to be the center of attention for a bit.

Dad and I tease one another sometimes about how different we can be in our family; he and Aurelio are both kind of clutterbugs, but I can't stand seeing anything out of place. I can't get comfortable in a messy house.

You've talked to Xochitl before, right? I feel really protective of her, so I wanted to warn you about something: don't make any jokes about fire, okay? She's been through a lot and she deserves to be a bit more happy and carefree. Losing her husband was horrible.

I went to go see "Greg's Revenge" with Xochitl and uh, let's just say: I do not ever, ever want to run into "Greg" in my lifetime. Nope! I'll keep enjoying my very normal, very werewolf-free life, please and thank you!
I grew up over on San Myshuno and moved out here because this is where all new tech jobs are these days. I never expected to find myself living in the burbs, though.

When I thought about being a dad, I totally had visions of the elaborate treehouse I'd help my kids build someday. I want my kids to have a fun little escape, plus I want that dad-kid bonding experience of working together on a project!
Sometimes, I just like to go for long walks around the lake over at Gilbert Gardens. It clears my head and helps relax me!

You know that little scar I have on my face? I got that a long time ago when I was learning to ride a bicycle back in the days when bikes were way less safe and helmets weren't the norm. You can bet my kiddos will be wearing a helmet when they're riding.
Deep, dark secret time: I am terrified of rabbits. It's silly, I know, but they just seem so dangerous somehow. You never know what a rabbit might do.
We're going to wait until Orion's a toddler before we adopt another kid, but I'm definitely hoping to have lots and lots of kids. What's better than a house full of love?
I'm glad I live somewhere where it doesn't snow, but sometimes I get a little blue about the rain. My wife's all about stormy weather, though. I guess she has a flair for the dramatic.
The other day, somebody joked that I spoil Atlas too much. Truth be told, I am a little worried about over-indulging him, but it's hard not to see a kid that happy and want to spoil him rotten.

I'm not necessarily the most amazing painter in the world, but I do love art. Sometimes I stop by the Rec Center just to see what other folks are creating. It's pretty inspiring - just watch out for that creepy clown painting.

Celeste has always said it's okay to talk about this stuff, but the day she came out to me to say that she was trans was so huge. I was surprised, but I also just thought that it somehow made so much sense for her. All I want is for my wife to be happy; it's really magical to see someone you love get to really, truly be themselves!

This guy, Kyle Kyleson, showed up on our doorstep a while back and he said we went to school together. Nice guy, though I swear I've never met him in my life. He made "chicken nuggies" for us and ever since then, Atlas has been begging to have him come back and stay again.
Bet it won't surprise you to hear that I have a rebellious streak. When I was a kid, I tried to break into that greenhouse in Gilbert Gardens. I was grounded for weeks.
I'm definitely kind of a horror movie freak. I guess that's obvious with the whole goth aesthetic, right? I could see "Death Mirror" over and over and over and...
Jay's so adorable. I love it that they have their own sense of style, even if it's a bit...eclectic. Everyone should feel okay to choose their own path, yeah?

Jay read one - one - article about wolf eels recently and has gone completely off the rails about scary critters in the ocean and in lakes. Tell me they haven't said anything to you about lake monsters. You know there's no lake monster, right?

We took Tala to the splash pad in the park recently and she was absolutely loving it. Apparently the little whale there is called "Whalebert" or something like that. Now she wants to know when we're getting our own Whalebert.

Our family does pretty well in terms of supporting ourselves, but I guess we're not as well-off as some folks. Can you imagine having the money to own a yacht? I feel like I'd rather spend the money on something more interesting or artistic, but to each their own.
One of my fashion advice posts went viral recently and yeesh. Talk about pressure. I don't know that I have enough energy to keep up with that lifestyle, though I admire those who can!

My sister-in-law, Bernice, gave us a super-fancy dollhouse for Tala recently. There's been a bit of rift between her and Jay lately and I'm trying to stay out of it, but I wish they'd just talk things out. In my family, that's always how we handle things: we talk when we have problems and we work through them.
Ever since I met Jay when they were out swimming with their sister at the park, I've known we were meant to be together. I know it's corny but when you know, you know.

You've met Ignacio, my father-in-law, right? He's always looking out for everyone. His wife passed away a long time ago, but he still hasn't gotten serious with anyone new. But it's never too late, right? Maybe he'll meet a new love!

It's interesting to hear Ignacio talk a lot about how much the area has changed over the years. They used to have trees so big they'd cut holes into them for you to ride your bike through, but now a lot of those trees are gone—down to just the stumps, even. Have you seen any of those stumps around?

Celeste and I are best friends, but I'm also pretty friendly with Christopher. He's really started coming out of his shell since he got married and they had kids. He loves art, too, so we always have plenty to talk about.
Do you think I can convince Xochitl to let me put a few gnomes out in the yard? I so want to have a nice little gnome collection.
You know what I think? If you don't have a sense of humor about life, you're missing out.

I grew up here, you know. My family had a tiny little place out in Hopewell Hills back when it was just called "the hills." They went through a big effort to revitalize and rebrand it as a nice little suburban area. Which it was, but let's just say that the incomes of the people living there changed and now it's people who have a bit more money than my family had.

I love taking care of children. I think it's important to be a kind and nurturing presence in their lives, and I like to shake things up a little too. You know, give kids a piece of hard candy here and there or take them to the splash pad to play for hours!

Kyle Kyleson came by and stayed with us a few weeks ago and I have to tell you a secret: while he was here, I pranked the toilet. You know what's funny? He seemed to be the kind of person who knows how to prank quite a few toilets himself, though he's actually more well-mannered than he looks like he is.
I really love the way that Xochitl embraces her family and teaches Karmine to appreciate who she is without putting pressure on her. She's a really good mom, you know.

I really hope I'm not adding pressure on Xochitl by being in the house. I just want to help, but I worry that she thinks I'm bothersome. I think we have everything worked out now, but I still try hard to watch out for her. Just because she's my daughter-in-law doesn't mean I love her any less than I loved my son.

Karmine's had a loose tooth recently, so she's been learning all about the tooth fairy. I told her that she'll get a special surprise if she puts her tooth under the pillow after she loses it. Karmine thinks I was playing a joke on her, though!
Ignacio Robles came by again to talk to me. He's a nice fellow, and he does a lot to help people. I'd like to take my time getting to know him, though.

I lost my son Colin recently but I lost my husband many years ago. It's been a long time, but I still keep my wedding ring on to remember him by. Also, I keep my wedding ring on because I'm not quite so sure I'm up to dating again. Maybe the right person will come along sometime, though.
I try hard not to look too much like a fussy old lady. I've met some fussy old ladies in my day, including one who hits people with a handbag. Can you imagine being that rude?
I've been wanting to travel over to Copperdale to see their ferris wheel. Karmine's afraid of heights, but I'm sure if she just saw how it looks out there, she'd want to try riding it right away!

You'll never guess how I met my wife. I'm joking, I guess it's kind of obvious: we're both into fishing. Bernice is way better at it than I am, though. I don't know how she does it, but she almost never comes home empty handed. Sometimes I'm lucky just to catch a single minnow at the lake in Gilbert Gardens.
It's nice to see a new face around here. Do you have any hobbies? I like to keep busy!

My father-in-law's been trying to get better at Simbles, and he's been making me practice with him a bunch. I think I'm finally starting to get better at that game, though I wish sometimes he'd chill out and just work on a puzzle with me. I used to work on puzzles with my mom a lot.
I keep having this bizarre dream about something called a "Tooth Beary" coming to steal my teeth. Bernice tells me I'm being "eccentric" but those dreams are so vivid.

Gilbert Gilberts apparently gifted the whole park area to the city in his will. If you ask me, that's the least he could do after building up all those factories only to let the fishing industry collapse when he felt like his investments were better spent elsewhere. Probably not something to be talking about with a new friend, though, huh. Maybe this is why people think I'm so weird.
Do you ever get really harebrained ideas that won't go away? I used to get this idea that I just couldn't live anymore if I didn't buy a bee box, but then it stopped outta nowhere. What's that about?

I feel like this makes me a jerk, but I just don't get along well with one of my wife's friends. Xochitl isn't a bad person or anything, but we're a bit like oil and water. Anytime we talk, we're bound to disagree.

Being a writer is so stressful sometimes. Everyone thinks you're just full of great ideas, and sometimes you aren't. I got fired from a job once and I still feel like such a failure. I felt like I couldn't do anything right, you know? I hope that's not too much of a downer to share, but I really trust you.

My favorite thing about Bernice is how supportive she is of me. She reads everything I write, even if it's just an instruction manual. I've been working on a novel, and she's been reading it as I go and always has thoughtful stuff to say about it.

When Aurelio was younger, he used to love dancing with me. I guess it's silly to ask a teenager to dance with his dad, but am I weird for kind of wishing we could just let loose and goof around like that again? Aurelio can be so serious sometimes unless he's talking to his grandpa.

My father-in-law knows a lot about the area, and I've kinda been wondering if I should work on a history of San Sequoia. But where to begin? There's a lot of history here that'd require some digging—and maybe even some uncomfortable truths.

It's actually a little hard for me to make friends, so I'm glad we're getting to know one another a bit better. I like having someone to talk to sometimes, even if I suppose I'm not always very interesting.

I'm looking forward to getting to know you better. Everyone kind of jokes about it, but I try hard to get to know as many people in our community as we can. Community spirit is the glue that holds things together and keeps us all safe and happy.

Have you seen the fisherman statue in Hopewell Hills? That's my great grandpa, Bayani Robles. I have to laugh, they built up a little play area around him too with a pirate ship. I don't know what he would have thought about pirates, but I know his own boat was rather less fearsome-looking and a bit more on the run down side at first!

I like to put a lot of energy into community work. I suppose I could put my time into other hobbies more often, but it matters to me to make this place a good place to raise a family. My great-great grandpa saw a lot of potential here when he first moved out to start a fishing trade, and I intend to keep that legacy going.
That son-in-law of mine is such a card. The other day I swear I saw him trying to read a book while doing pushups. Pick a lane, kid!

Years ago, I gave my grandson, Aurelio, my wife's violin. I can tell he's outgrown it a little bit, but that's okay. I like to share family legacies, but I also want my family to develop their own personalities. I know his grandmother would love Aurelio's independent streak, too.

Some parents secretly have favorite kids. I know it, because I've seen it. But that's not my style. I love both of my children equally; they're amazing and unique folks and I wouldn't change a thing about them. Well, wait. I'd change one thing. I wish they got along better right now. But they will eventually, I'm sure of it.

I know I seem chipper a lot of the time, but even I have had rough patches. Losing my wife was really, really hard. We were a team, and now I'm playing solo and I get lonely sometimes. I'm hoping that maybe I can find another person to be with, though I can't replace the love I've lost.
I just love being a grandpa—a house full of children is a happy one for me.

You should come by for dinner sometime! I love cooking, and it'd be a pleasure to whip up something gourmet and scrumptious for you. These days, my cooking's mainly pizza-focused. No, it's not my grandson demanding it- it's Ian who is all about that Canadian bacon pizza.

Anchorpoint Wharf is pretty different even from the way I remember it as a kid. It was all factories for a while, then it was a bit run-down and off-putting. They've put a lot of money into revitalizing it. That's for the best, I guess, but sometimes it feels a little too polished. I can't complain too much, though; after all, they put in that anchor sculpture to commemorate my family's contributions!

I've been trying to stop by that Recreation Center a lot more lately since they spruced it up. There's a little game area now, and sometimes I go in to play some Simbles with folks. I'm actually not very good at Simbles, though I can play a mean game of chess.

As you know, the park is called Gilbert Gardens. The reason for that is pretty obvious if you've seen the old house within the park; way back when, that chunk of land was owned by a guy named Gilbert Gilberts. I kid you not! When he passed, he set up a trust to give the land to the city. I guess that's one way to apologize for cutting down half the sequoias in the area, eh?

I came out as nonbinary when I was in high school. My family was really chill about it. They/them feels right, though I am pretty fluid. My family all asked me what I'd prefer to be called in terms of name and so on; I said I'm fine with "sibling" or "brother" and "uncle" as well. That stuff's always a really personal decision and I appreciate my family asking first and respecting me without question. I know many nonbinary people really don't want any gendered stuff and I totally get it.
We're working hard on making Tala more independent. She gets a bit nervous when she can't be around us all the time, but as she grows up I know she'll be a lot more autonomous.
I remember the first time I made grilled cheese all by myself. Nearly started the kitchen on fire, but it kicked off my love affair with cooking. Of course, dad always helped inspire that, too.
You ever just wake up in the morning and think "oh yeah, today's a great day to wear a raccoon costume?" Because I do, uh, every day.

When I was a kid, my dad used to take me swimming at the lake over in Gilbert Gardens all the time. Then, one day, I felt something bite one of my toes. Fairly certain there's a lake monster. Or maybe a minnow did it. Or it's a lake monster. Yep! Lake monster. I'm sure if it.

Yet again, I've asked Doli if I can paint the living room with rainbow stripes. I do this every few weeks, cuz the answer might change. This time, Doli just laughed for a really long time and walked away. I guess some people don't want rainbow everything? She says it's fashion; I say it's boring. Oh no. Don't tell her I said that.
I'm lobbying really hard to take a family trip over to Henford-on-Bagley this year. You know what sold me? I heard that some of the foxes there like it when you sing to them.

My dad'll tell you all about it, but we have a long family history here in San Sequoia. A long time ago, we first came here and got involved in the fishing trade, then opened up our own canning factory. Most of those factories are gone now. Can you believe they turned one factory building into a theater?

My sister and I haven't gotten along as well lately and it's stressful. She kinda questions our parenting style sometimes. I get where she's coming from, but we're doing our best with Tala. Parenting is complicated!
My nephew Aurelio always calls me a "Disaster They." Can anyone explain what that is? I don't think I'm a disaster, but...

In my family, we have a tradition: we have anchor tattoos. Kinda funny since a lot of kids have parents who don't want them to get tattoos, but my dad was always excited about the day Bernice and I would be old enough to get our own tattoos.
We're really into music in the Robles family. My wedding present from my dad was a piano that looks just like the one my parents had growing up. Pretty cool.
Have you ever seen a llama in person before? My mom says sometimes they spit. Do you know how to draw a llama? Can you teach me?
My gramma Eleanor is so silly. The other day I was late to school because she pranked the toilet. My teacher didn't even believe me. She said grammas don't prank toilets. Yeah right!
My mom likes taking me to the Rec Center sometimes to play with other kids, but the music they have playing there is kind of annoying. Ugh.
If I can grow up to be anything I want, I want to be able to take care of animals. Or I want to be an artist. I bet I can do both if I try hard.

Last time we went to the movies as a family, there was this super tall person in front of my gramma. She got really annoyed, and mom kept telling her to be patient. We still got up and moved. I liked the movie.

Mom always tells me how proud she is that I am kind to other kids and that I have creative spirit. The truth is, sometimes I get really mad though and I don't want to be kind or nice. Sometimes I just wanna stomp and get mad! Is that okay?
When I was littler, I thought the moon disappeared and had to make itself all over again every single night. Did you know that's where my name is from? The moon?

I dunno, man. It's just been a week y'know? Just...you ever see something you just can't un-see or get out of your head? Last week I set my LlamaBerry PowerSip on a bench while I was doing pushups at the park and a squirrel came by and like...knocked it over. Full can. Total waste. I'm clawing my way back to normalcy man, but it's a long road.

You ever go drive up to Moonwood Mill? Bro, those guys know how to party. I was about 6 PowerSips deep and all of a sudden they start gettin' rowdy, screamin' and taking off their shirts. Was totally awesome. Me and my boy Josh used to go hard way back, but that was nuts. Maybe its something in the water over there.

People get so pressed about me doing pushups sometimes. They say things like "Why are you doing pushups right now" or "I'm calling the cops." Like just chill, doing pushups is like blinking for me, and we all gotta blink from time to time. Except for my boy Josh, yo he like never blinked. Was kinda creepy but also super rad.

Word of advice: don't do your dishes in that splash pad thing at the park. Went out there for a sort of Simstagram hashtag simple living moment, ended up with a bunch of dogs fighting with me for scraps while some scandalized moms glared at me. Extremely bad vibes.

I got banned from the movie theater last week. I'm hoping they don't ban me for long but it was such a crummy deal. You talk once in a movie—that, by the way, I was all by myself at cuz I guess it was the last-ever showing of The Llama Hums at Midnight and I was talkin' through a scary part and next thing I know the usher's telling me I'm banned?

Alright, you keep asking me about that whole exploding toilet thing and I'm starting to feel guilty. Can I tell you the truth? I never made any toilet explode. Ever. It was just small misunderstanding with best boy Josh. But he thought it was the raddest thing ever, and went on to tell the rest of the boys. They loved it. I can never let them down. I will bear this shame. For the boys.
You ever have a rough day? I don't have many, but when I do, I like to unwind with a plate of chicken nuggies and a bit of zoning out in front of the TV. I could watch sitcoms for hours, man.

Dude, I gotta say, you're like the REALEST person I know. If I had to choose you between you and my best boy Josh— Whoa that thought just made me SUPER SAD. I cant choose between bros. I love all my bros equally! Ah shoot I got some of that "feeling sweat" in my eyes again, BRO I need a tissue.

You ever go to that Rec Center place? They built that up just recently I guess. Anyway, I see old people sometimes playing in there and I figured they were lonely so I sat down and played a game with them and it turns out I'm kind of a genius at that Simbles thing.

I don't think of myself as a couch surfer, I think of myself as a couch-trepreneur. Shocked? Listen, I have about a billion startup ideas, I just— bwahaha, no, no, man, I'm so sorry, I gotta stop there. Startup ideas. Me? Can you imagine? No way. For starters, do I look like a guy who wants to wear those weird puffy vests? Haha yeah right - unless?

I got this idea, right. You know how emojis kind of speak for themselves sometimes? Like instead of words? It's crazy right? What if we could somehow transfer that into like - real life, you know? I'm gonna do an "emoji face" right now, can you tell what I'm trying to say? — BRO no lie I think I'm onto something. I gotta write this down.

I had pretty big dreams for myself once upon a time. You know I was Prom King at Copperdale my senior year? For real! It went a little downhill after I sort-of-kind-of-accidentally made a school toilet blow up. Don't ask about the toilet thing. I mean it. DON'T ask about the toilet thing!

Hey, did you see all those fancy painted utility boxes all around Anchorpoint Wharf? I guess they got tired of someone who definitely isn't me tagging them and decided to paint 'em officially. Pretty sweet, though.

The first time Karmine came to me to tell me that she had a loose tooth, she asked if she's supposed to wiggle it and I confess I got kinda grossed out by it when she tried. Whew. Sometimes you forget that being a mom involves some gross stuff. Like, you know, the time she peed on me when I was changing her...

You know the tough thing about getting new tattoos? How itchy they are after. Everyone always asks if the ones I have hurt to get, and I just have to tell them that it's really more annoying to be that itchy without any way to scratch 'em.

I have some equipment here at home, but I kinda like going to the Rec Center to work out. It's a nice chance to talk to folks and, well, hear all the local gossip. I fully admit to being a bit of a gossip hound.
I planned a baby shower for Bernice, and her husband was so into helping out. Apparently, he found out about all these "mom" juice drinks we can make—you ever hear of a "mom-osa?"

Elephant in the room: I know people talk, and yes- I did lose my husband a while back. Colin and I loved each other a lot, and I miss him every day. But he wouldn't want me to be sad about him all the time, so I focus on keeping my life in the present.

I am trying so hard not to get involved, but I can tell that Ignacio Robles is a bit interested in Eleanor. He should ask her out already! I bet she'd love to go on dates with him. The two of them are goofy enough to get along perfectly, right?

I admit to not really liking Ian Robles all that much. He's talented, but he just has this habit of saying the absolute weirdest thing to you. As in, I agree that there are some really shady dealings that happened in this area a long time ago, way before the Robles family moved here even, but do you have to talk about that when we're having girl's night in?

I'm an athlete, so people think I might be really vain. I can be, but our bodies are also just evidence that we're living beings. For example? I have tons of stretch marks from when I had Karmine. Some folks with those are proud of them or call them tiger stripes and things like that. I think that's cool, but for me, I just work towards being neutral about some parts of my body. I don't have to love everything, but I don't have to be embarrassed about it either.
Karmine is going to be the most amazing artist, I can tell. She brings the most amazing drawings home from school, and she has an amazing imagination. I hope she holds onto that as she grows up.
Karmine's very first sleeping bag had llamas all over it. You should have seen how excited she was about it—she couldn't wait to start going to slumber parties!

Seeing Celeste and Christopher happy together is so sweet. I've had breakups before that weren't always so smooth, but Christopher's just such a nice guy. Life's too short to hold a grudge for long, you know?

I try really hard to cultivate a chill and relaxed sort of home. At first, it was a big adjustment to have Eleanor move in after my husband Colin passed away, but we had a lot of good discussions about our boundaries and I think clearing the air helped. We both just want to make sure that Karmine has a normal childhood no matter what, and I like working together with Eleanor to achieve that.

Sim Characteristic preferences will determine what types of personalities this Sim will be socially compatible with. Sim Characteristics are determined from several aspects, including (but not limited to!) a Sim's traits, experiences they've had in life, or activities they Like/Dislike!

Not every conversation can be a great one! Conversation Topic preferences dictate how a Sim will react when another Sim performs that type of interaction on them. For example, if one Sim performs a Small Talk interaction on another Sim who dislikes Small Talk, it will have a much smaller chance of success than normal.

Ambitionless Sims tend to lack the motivation to improve personally or professionally. They might avoid putting in hard work in their career, or maybe they prefer to laze about their messy homes.\n\nLiking Ambitionless Sims means other Sims with traits like Lazy or Slob will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Ambitious will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Argumentative Sims tend to quarrel often with other Sims. Perhaps it's because they feel a bit insecure, or they like the thrill of winning a debate. Or maybe they just enjoy being mean!\n\nLiking Argumentative Sims means other Sims with traits like Hot-Headed, Mean, or Evil will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Good will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Cerebral Sims tend to favor logical, scientific, or technological pursuits. Perhaps they enjoy a competitive game of chess, diving into a new book, or achieving virtual greatness in video games!\n\nLiking Cerebral Sims means other Sims with traits like Genius, Geek, or Bookworm will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Creative or Goofball will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Egotistical Sims tend to be self-centered, preoccupied with how other Sims think of them. Perhaps they like to look down upon other Sims while buying only the nicest things, or maybe they just enjoy looking in the mirror a bit too much.\n\nLiking Egotistical Sims means other Sims with traits like Snob or Materialistic will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Good will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Emotional Decision-Makers are in tune with their feelings, but can often be led astray by them! Perhaps they find comfort in the release of anger. Or perhaps they're uncomfortable in their relationships, whether it's due to envy or fear of settling down.\n\nLiking Emotional Decision-Makers means other Sims with traits like Hot-Headed, Jealous, or Non-Committal will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Self-Assured will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Funny Sims are playful folks that will (at least try to) always keep other Sims smiling. They love to pursue humor and mischief, and aren't afraid to look a bit foolish in the process.\n\nLiking Funny Sims means other Sims with traits like Goofball will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Snob will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Hard-Working Sims are not afraid to put in long hours to improve their life and achieve greatness! They often hold themselves to high standards, presenting themselves to the world as polished as possible.\n\nLiking Hard-Working Sims means other Sims with traits like Ambitious, Perfectionist, or Neat will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Lazy or Slob will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

High Energy Sims are all about action! They tend to enjoy active hobbies and adventures, often ones that require athletic skill or feats of strength. High Energy Sims will generally prioritize fitness as well.\n\nLiking High Energy Sims means other Sims with traits like Active will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Lazy will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Homebodies are Sims that prefer to stay home and pursue more calm, laid back endeavors. Rather than a loud party, they tend to prefer cozy nights spent cooking, crafting, gaming, or reading at home.\n\nLiking Homebody Sims means other Sims with traits like Loner, Bookworm, or Clumsy will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Active or Loves Outdoors will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Idealist Sims love to imagine, and don't care much for being practical or logical! They might enjoy the creations of others, or maybe they're motivated to create things themselves. They're often drawn to all sorts of creative hobbies, whether visual or musical.\n\nLiking Idealist Sims means other Sims with traits like Creative, Art Lover, or Music Lover will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Genius will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Family-Motivated Sims are often very dedicated to their families. They also tend to find contentment spending time with the youngsters in their lives.\n\nLiking Family-Motivated Sims means other Sims with traits like Family-Oriented or Childish will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Hates Children will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Rascals are Sims that embrace being a nuisance! Whether it's through hilarious Mischief, stealing the belongings of other Sims, or even enjoying being downright mean, Rascals sure know how to get on other Sims' nerves!\n\nLiking Rascals means other Sims with traits like Goofball, Kleptomaniac, or Mean will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Snob will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Nature Enthusiasts are Sims that care deeply for the environment! They aren't content to sit indoors all day, as they love getting outside. Some might even choose to not eat meat out of respect for other species of the natural world. \n\nLiking Nature Enthusiasts means other Sims with traits like Loves Outdoors or Vegetarian will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Lazy will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Optimistic Sims always try to look on the bright side of life! They seek to radiate light and positivity, and brighten the days of other Sims around them.\n\nLiking Optimistic Sims means other Sims with traits like Cheerful or Good will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Gloomy will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Pessimistic Sims tend to have negative outlooks on life. Perhaps they feel sad often, or maybe they assume the worst about those closest to them.\n\nLiking Pessimistic Sims means other Sims with traits like Gloomy, Jealous, or Hates Children will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Cheerful will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Pet Enthusiasts are obsessed with fuzzy friends of many kinds, whether house pets or farm animals! They love and respect their animal companions, and seek to treat them like any other Sim. \n\nLiking Pet Enthusiasts means other Sims with traits that involve liking animals or pets will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Evil will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Romance Enthusiasts may be naturally flirty, but are also deeply committed to their loved one! Not only do they easily charm other Sims, they value the deep respect and trust that comes with true love.\n\nLiking Romance Enthusiasts means other Sims with traits like Romantic will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Noncommittal will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Spirited Sims are all about that positive energy, and making sure to spread good vibes to other Sims. They bring the party with them, in any social situation!\n\nLiking Spirited Sims means other Sims with traits like Outgoing, Bro, or Cheerful will gain some compatibility with your Sim. However, traits like Gloomy will lower their compatibility with your Sim.

Whether it's Friendly or Romantic, showing Affection is an expression of adoration towards another Sim. Some Sims love receiving Affection from their friends and loved ones, but others might be a bit hesitant to accept such deep expressions of their connection.

Whether winning or losing in the end, some Sims just enjoy the furious debate of a heated argument. If they like Arguments, they welcome other Sims to challenge them in verbal battle! Though others that dislike Arguments will be particularly disgruntled when argued with.

For Sims that like Complaints, hearing others whine about life can be refreshing! Life isn't all sunshine and daisies! But for those that dislike it, they'd rather other Sims keep their complaints to themselves.
While some Sims enjoy a bit of suave appreciation from a compliment, others might not like that type of attention!

Deception refers to (usually) benevolent lies told by Sims in the name of Mischief, to trick other Sims. Sims who like Deception appreciate humorous lies as an art form! While those who dislike it would rather avoid falsehoods altogether.

Sims that like Deep Thoughts want to take conversations beyond the surface. They particularly enjoy thought-provoking or emotional conversations. Sims that dislike Deep Thoughts just want conversations to be a bit easier and lighthearted!

Ooh la la! Flirtation fills a conversation with lovey-dovey talk and beguiling, romantic one-liners. For some Sims, it's the perfect way to set the mood! For others, it's the perfect way to make them cringe!
Sims that like Gossip want all the tea, all the time. However, those that dislike Gossip might find it rude to hear about other Sims behind their back!

Hobbies are activities (usually related to skills) that Sims can learn to enjoy doing. Some Sims love hearing others discuss their hobby-related adventures at length, but others might find it hard to relate to!

A Sim's interests can vary widely—literature, science, or even philosophical ponderings about a Sim's way of life! Sims who like Discussing Interests enjoy hearing about the interests of others, while Sims who dislike it might find those conversations boring!
Knock knock! Sometimes jokes are a great way to fill the space in an otherwise lackluster conversation. But some Sims just don't appreciate the humor like others do!

Malicious interactions are just downright rude! While most Sims find these interactions to be off-putting, Sims who like Malicious interactions are more inclined to appreciate the art of a finely crafted insult.
For Sims who like Physical Intimacy, romantic touch is their love language! Those who dislike it might prefer to maintain stronger romantic boundaries.
Potty Humor can be the pinnacle of comedy for some Sims who like it. But for others, they'd rather have conversations that keep their distance from the bathroom!
Sims that like Pranks can appreciate a good "Gotcha!" moment, even as the one being pranked! But Sims that dislike them hate getting pranked!
A bit of random goofing around can bring a smile to some Sims' faces. But try acting silly with Sims who dislike it? A-nnoying!
Small Talk never goes deeper than surface level chit-chat. Some Sims like the safety of those types of conversations, while others might find them to be a total bore.
Stories are powerful! Some Sims find that good stories bring a conversation alive, while others might fear the potential of a bad story to completely ruin a conversation.

Crafted with same Mission-style solid wood look you've grown to love over the years. This time, the mission is a successful diaper change with minimal mess & stress (good luck with that one, new parents!)

Schitts, unveiled the final imperfection of their design in an unfortunate (but legendary) diaper change incident, paving the way for perfection in the form of the 3000th model. Now available in public restrooms worldwide, providing streamlined, convenient diaper changes for toddlers and infants on the go!

Some things were just meant to be on the left. Like this bookcase, carefully crafted to fit perfectly on the left end of the rest of your "Reading is Groovy!" bookcases from Kindermade. If there's one thing we can do at Kindermade, it's achieving unprecedented levels of product synergy! For this bookcase, we harnessed energy that was very... left. Fully scientifically proven, of course.

Some things were just meant to be on the right. Like this bookcase, carefully crafted to fit perfectly on the right end of the rest of your "Reading is Groovy!" bookcases from Kindermade. If there's one thing we can do at Kindermade, it's achieving unprecedented levels of product synergy! For this bookcase, we harnessed energy that was very... not left. Fully scientifically proven, of course.

For Kindermade's "Reading is Groovy!" line of bookcases, we've taken our practice of capitalizing on your childhood nostalgia and cranked it up to the max! The square shelf was calculated to have the exact proportions needed to elicit strong childhood memories. Toy blocks, board games, report cards, your father's Sunday morning French toast, the saltine crackers your mother gave you to nibble on when your tummy was upset. Name a bittersweet childhood memory, chances are we optimized for it. Gotta love science!
Reading is Groovy! v.2 (Square) by Kindermade

Audio transcription from design meeting led by Kindermade's Head of Product, Ivana Gotuda-Bafrüm, and several lead designers and engineers.\n\nSo, let me get this straight...you come to me with this pitch. "The numbers don't lie," you said, and focus groups proved the colorful-shaped shelves make people feel nostalgic. Those same focus groups you told me ended with people hugging that triangle-shaped bookshelf while sobbing over their 5th-grade pizza parties. [A hand slams down on a wooden desk] And you have the audacity to bring me this trash? A bookcase with normal shelves?! What, did you forget to put your manufactured nostalgia beacons on this one? [She scoffs, as papers shuffle and the designers mumble to one another] You know what? You're all fired! Simon, get R&D on the phone and ask them if they can make...puppy-shaped shelves. Anything but this!
Reading is Groovy! v.1 by Kindermade

For Kindermade's "Reading is Groovy!" line of bookcases, we've taken our practice of capitalizing on your childhood nostalgia and cranked it up to the max! The circular and triangular shelves were calculated to have the exact proportions needed to elicit strong childhood memories. Your uncle's blueberry pancakes, birthday hats worn on a warm summer evening in the park, your first soccer ball, a cool slice of watermelon eaten poolside. Name a bittersweet childhood memory, chances are we optimized for it. Gotta love science!
Reading is Groovy! v.3 (TriCircle) by Kindermade

So yeah, this one is a bunch of old wood and metal too. But, this time not only are the materials reclaimed, the space is too. Now with more shelving space for your assorted tchotchkes. Or, just put more books on it again if that's what you really want.
What can you do with some old wood and metal? You can make a bookshelf to hold every book you've ever wanted to read and will get around to and it won't even judge how many unread books it holds.
