Where do these things come from anyway? Where do grandparents even get these from? Are they bought in bulk somewhere? Maybe some mysteries are better left unsolved...
Fire it up and blow your guests away! Figuratively speaking, of course. This cannon will be sure to add some flare to your event. Just...be sure to activate it correctly!
Look at this thing! Those stones aren't all uniform. It took a true craftsperson to put it together, and it's perfect for any home.
Show everyone in the neighborhood that your home is the best by adding some crowns to your chimney. No, really...that's all it takes.
A true craftsperson puts their heart and soul into everything they do. These corbels are a testament to how much they care about how a home looks.

So here's the thing. Your cousin Viktor got a fancy new sewing machine for his birthday. And he's been making "new" curtains for everyone. It's the one thing he knows how to make. Remember those expensive, antique placemats that Aunt Misty and Uncle Jackie always keep locked away in their fancy china cabinet, wouldn't let anyone use 'em? Well, Vik's been making the curtains out of those. No clue how he managed to get his hands on those placemats. But, uh, just remember to take them down next time your aunt and uncle come over. Please.

Oh, it's you. Fine, if I absolutely must I'll explain this. What is it you called it? A "curtain" or whatever sort of simple word you used.\n\n*scoff* Well of course, it goes on a window! Why exactly do I have to be here explaining this to... you. I've seen more refinement from a wild animal! Such basic tastes! This is so below me!

Oh, goodness me, you again? Must I continuously give you these lessons about... window coverings? Let me guess, you don't have curtains on any of your windows, do you?\n\n*scoff* Listen here, you uncultured peasant. I am deeply educated on what makes a finely crafted, artisan textile. I wouldn't expect someone like you to understand.
A certificate celebrating your first tooth loss!
Here they are in all their glory: the Tooth Fairy! The wonderous, mystical feature that praises you for your good dental deeds and even leaves a sparkling simoleon or two under your pillow.

Yes, the Tooth Fairy has wings, but did you know they also have a rainbow cape? While it's true that the bones in your jaw shouldn't have any colorful flaws, the Tooth Fairy can't help themselves by adding a little flare to their look.
Celebrate your new teeth with this adorable poster of the Tooth Fairy! Your teeth will twinkle and shine just like the stars.
Legend has it, the Tooth Fairy has a friend named the Molar Bear, a bright, shiny round pal that leads the fight against enamel cruelty.

Kids grow way too fast. One day they're in diapers, then it seems like by the next, they're off to university and getting married! Or, for some families, one day they're in diapers, then it'll seem like the next day they're still living in your basement as an adult, running up the water bill with 45 minute showers, eating all the food, and throwing parties while you and your spouse are taking a camping trip in Granite Falls (Kenny if you're reading this, get a job already, for goodness sake!) Either way, this chart will help keep track of their height while there's still hope.

You thought woodland creatures couldn't read? Joke's on you, that sloth has a PhD! Couldn't you tell from the glasses? And that giraffe you see on one of these decals? She's one of the top animal lawyers in the world, taking on only the most elite clients. But your preconceived notions would've led you to believe she was just another animal out there.\n\nNext time, don't judge a book by its cover! *crowd boos, tomatoes splat on the stage*
The world is full of wonders. Bring a little of that into your space with these decals.
Add some whimsy to your space with an adorable tree that's home to a couple of owls. Does it look like their eyes are always watching you? Maybe just a little. Still cute though!
These bright and active decals are the perfect addition for any gym space or workout room. Get moving!

Let's be honest, studying isn't that groovy. Exams are the harbingers of caffeine-fueled late nights, hours and hours spent stressed in drab interiors. But ask yourself, does your agony have to be drab? NO! So let us help you! Thanks to Kindermade's KinderMod line, you can suffer in style. And when it's 3 AM the night before the final, the coffee is all gone, and you've reached the end of your patience and willpower, gaze into the vibrant colors and remember: Kindermade was there for you!

What's the shape of your child's productivity? Is it nonlinear, unpredictable, or even nonexistent? Well, change it to something a bit more sharp and consistent with this finely shaped desk! Never again will that homework go unfinished! Never again will that way-too-expensive computer sit on a way-too-boring desk!

With a patented design that includes the highest quality clear plastic window, this desk will keep anyone from feeling like they're stuck in a cubicle. At least they'll be able to see what's going on in the outside world.

The work of a craftsperson makes all the difference in a home. Look at the detail in this archway! The wood is meticulously carved, and the stained glass is a work of art in itself. This archway will add character in any home and keep the space between rooms open.

Everybody knows that the door into the home sets the tone. With this Well Crafted Door, your house will feel top of the line, and will show any visitor that your home is full of character and good taste.
Mix the natural feel of wooden planks with the modern sleekness of the frame and get a door that's nothing short of a work of art.

Home is where the heart is, and this door is giving the heart a glow up! Nothing beats this intricate, hand-crafted design by premier craftspeople to make a place feel cozy and beautiful at the same time.

From the renowned designers that brought you Wicker Whims, the all new Woven Whims collection shows a more delicate, tender side of the brand's iconic woven wood accents. This dresser features an artisan wood frame, and it's adorned with a hand-crafted cane weave that'll make any interior design lover swoon!
A potion that has the power to remove a Family Dynamic between two Sims. Use with caution!

Combining the sweetness of berries with the essence of llama, we've once again turned the impossible into the delicious. Power-Sip is our art, and your mouth is our canvas. Sip. The. Power. Power-Sip.

With this fireplace, you will have the most catalog-ready, picturesque fireplace in the neighborhood. And when Debby comes over to plan the upcoming PTA bake sale, she'll definitely notice. And she'll be very jealous. And she'll subtly comment on it, but you can't tell if it was a compliment or an insult. And then she'll furiously search for it once she leaves your house. And two months later she'll have a fireplace installed that looks eerily similar (but not quite the same) to yours. And when you arrive to her cookout, potato salad in hand, you'll joke about it lightheartedly. And she'll pretend to not remember seeing yours, with a devilish grin on her face.\n\nOr something like that!

Electricity has made a world of difference in the kitchen, but that doesn't mean it has to make a difference in style. This fridge has a classic style with all the modern wonders that comes with being able to keep your food cold without giant ice blocks.
Pastel orange, blue, and white diagonal stripes
Grey, blue, and white diamond pattern
White and various shades of grey chevron pattern

Do you have a friend that is better than all other friends? Do you want to display your super special friendship to the world? Make your other friends jealous? Form a special sort of magical bond that will withstand the test of time—until your bracelet inevitably falls apart? Well, are you going to be happy! Pull out this kit and get to bracelet-making! Using this kit you can create up to five different versions of bracelets, but don't forget...you can only have one super-duper bracelet buddy! That's how the magic of friendship works!
A puzzle to build alone or with others.
A puzzle, forever preserved in a frame.
A tray to hold Simbles tiles.
Why would anyone not pair this gate with their gorgeous new fence? Some things are just better together.

The Way-to-Play Playmat is Playing Way's newest edition to its Tons of Smiles collection, guaranteed to make any tiny bun smile a ton. With its flexible framework, engaging bauble array, and adorable animal themes, this playmat will have your baby over the moon with excitement. Trust us when we say, any way to play on Playing Way's Way-to-Play Playmat is a great way to play, on any day!
A cousin to the famous Whalebert fountain in San Sequoia, Lil' Whalebert is the perfect size for young toddlers looking to climb and slide to their heart's content.

Meticulously handcrafted by San Sequoian underground glass artist Bale Bagooly (who has ironically never been seen in San Sequoia, or lived there during his adult life, but somehow never fails to tell anyone that he's from there), his young daughter once joked that this perfect circle of light was reminiscent of a cheese wheel rolled in fresh from the Tartosan riviera. Bagooly agreed, hence the name.
"The Cheese Wheel: Suspended" by Bale Bagooly

As they say, lamp is a two-way street. Get it? Because this lamp has 2 lights, and they shine both ways. It's very deep honestly, I wouldn't expect you to understand. I don't need your approval. I made this lamp. And everyone I tell about it? They tell me "Wow, that's the most smartest and coolest idea for a lamp ever!" And then they start to weep at the absolute most amazing idea that I had. And then everyone within a 100 meter vicinity stands and claps. And then I win international lamp-making competitions without even entering them because I'm a household name in the lamp-making world. And you aren't.

It's me again. I made the same amazing, world-endingly beautiful, innovative, inspirational, absolutely stunning, breathtaking lamp. But it's a little bit longer. Why? Because life is long. And life is beautiful and precious. Almost as beautiful and precious as my lamp. And me. Now clap, or else you'll be the only one not doing it.
Two-Way Street Ceiling Lamp - Less Short
Have a Recreation center with short walls and need a light that won't bonk you in the head? Maybe you just are afraid of lights that dangle too much? This is the perfect light.

Sometimes you just need the perfect light for a Recreation Center Lobby, and you are looking around and you see ones that are too short and ones that are too long. Worry no more! This is a perfectly medium sort of length lobby light.

Is your Recreation Center better than other recreation centers? After all, all "better" recreation centers have tall ceilings, right? Everyone knows that. Well, this lobby light is very long, and it'll fit perfectly in the lobby of one of those tall, better recreation centers.
The bane of every mailman's existence.
Hey, This Mailbox is a Lamp!

No one in the family can really remember where this lamp came from, but it's been passed down like a beloved sweater. Despite its age, it's still perfect for a study and gives you the light you want when you want it...and you'll get used to the faint buzzing when it's turned on.

For years, this lantern was used for fishing out on foggy San Sequoia bay. To keep history alive, it was retrofitted with a lightbulb to work in modern-day décor. Bring in the catch-of-the-day to your home!
Your little ones will sleep sweetly and safely under the protective glow of the crescent moon.

Why get a new lamp when they all work the same? At least that's what your grandpa said when he gave you this lamp he got from his grandma. If it plugs in and lights up the room, then it's doing its job.
Add some old time charm to your home without running the risk of setting your house on fire with this wall light. Your grandmother won't notice the difference.
This modern wall light is giving big flashlight, don't you think?
Add a little vintage flair to your home with this wall light. Rumor has it these were the favorite of an old San Sequoia resident as they were building their home.
Clean, tidy, and modern—these lockers are great for any Recreation Center changing room!
Sample dishes from around the world in eighty bites or less. If it takes you more than eighty bites, seek medical attention!
Around the World in 80 Bites Food Stall
It's giving attention. With a sturdy, rounded edge design, use this mirror for all your reflective needs!

Not enough space for our full-length mirror? Well, here's the wall version. Get ready for the day with this sleek, modern wall mirror. You look good! And we're not just saying that because we want you to buy this mirror.
Bring natural elements into your home with this wall mirror by Wicker-Work. Stay grounded as you freshen up, practice your next big speech, and make sure you look your best.

Someone in the family bought this ornate mirror once upon a time, and it's been collecting dust for ages. Now that it's cleaned up, you have a place to make sure you're full body acting or that your outfit looks the way you want it to. This found mirror will help boost your mood whenever you need it!

For years, San Sequoia was known for producing some of the finest upright pianos along the coast. This classic upright piano came in a variety of colors and can be found in many homes and businesses around the area. Today, local artists have taken to painting them and reselling for charitable profits. They're just another little piece of Bay Area history.
Perfect for the Sim who has traveled the world and wants to see a reminder of the places they've been! And perfect for the Sim who is bursting with dreams to see the world!
Want to show off amazing art pieces collected over the generations from your family's travels? Want to just look like your family is well traveled? This collection of art is for you.

Proudly display three of your finest family photos! Or just three photos of, well, whatever you'd like. Whatever makes you happy, dude.\n\nThree small photographs taken by a Sim may be dragged onto the frames to display.
HodgePodge Photo Collage Frames: Three's Company
Unlock by completing the Family Reunion event at (or above) the Bronze level.

Proudly display three of your finest family photos, and one larger family photo! Or just four photos of, well, whatever you'd like. Whatever makes you happy, dude.\n\nThree small photographs and one medium sized photograph taken by a Sim may be dragged onto the frames to display.
HodgePodge Photo Collage Frames: Four's (Still) a Crowd
Unlock by completing the Family Reunion event at the Gold Level.

Proudly display four of your finest family photos! Or just four photos of, well, whatever you'd like. Whatever makes you happy, dude.\n\nFour small photographs taken by a Sim may be dragged onto the frames to display.
HodgePodge Photo Collage Frames: Four's a Crowd
Unlock by completing the Family Reunion event at (or above) the Silver level.

You bought me, your first houseplant. You set me on the ground in a simple, solid-colored pot. But then, you bought an even bigger plant, put it in a fancy two-toned pot on a stand so it's looming even taller over me even more? And my reward for persevering, living every day in the shadow of that new and improved plant of yours? You bought another, even bigger one. On an even taller stand with an even nicer pot. Of course, you did!\n\nHa, what's next, a cute little toolbox of succulents next to me to remind me I can't even bank on being small and charming? I know you'd never be that cruel, right?
This bamboo once helped someone win a hide-and-seek contest, and now it can help you hide the less-than-perfect spots in your home.

This unit is a steal and will not be on the market long! This studio apartment has been hand carved from a wonderful specimen of fungi, cultivated in-house by Fungi Realty Inc. for only our most miniature of clients! Scenic staircase leads into a spacious front garden that boasts great views of the neighboring giant's backyard! The Interior comes furnished with adorably stylized mycelian furniture.\n\nNote: Fungi Realty Inc. is legally obligated to warn potential renters of dangers from unwieldy miniature young versions of giant neighbors, and any hungry, furry beasts the giant neighbors keep as companions.
The hourglass shape of this plant stand is here to remind you that good things take time. The plant that now calls it home took time to grow into the space-brightening greenery it is today.
This floral arrangement will look amazing on any table, but it might steal the spotlight from the dinner you made.
Potty-Time Buddy cheers you on when you're learning to use the potty! Look at that face! We're all having fun here! Aren't we?

Generations have potty trained their little ones on this potty chair, and it's worked just fine. Bring it out of storage and keep your family tradition (or thrift it and keep some family's tradition) and get to the potty training. It may be a little old fashioned, but you know what they say: if it ain't broke, don't fix it.

Passed down through five generations of proud owners, this rug boasts some of the highest durability of any antique rug on the market. Oddly enough, there's no explicit branding on the rug, which has spawned many rumors surrounding its origins. The only remaining clues lie on the rug's underside, which houses the nearly shredded remains of a tag that (if you stare at it long enough) seems to spell out "L nv k's Lo n" and a rather conspicuous scratch along the same edge.
The youngest in your family learns how to have good taste in decorations early in life. The Thoroughly Modern Mobile is the perfect décor for any Thoroughly Modern kid.
The youngest in your family learns how to have good taste in decorations early in life. The Thoroughly Modern Mobile is the perfect décor for any Thoroughly Modern kid.
When you have a budding artist, it's not uncommon to run out of space to show off all their drawings! This board is here to help display everything created by the next famous artist among us.

With a unicorn as a best friend and a set of wings, Teddy is an inspiration to all! Expertly crafted with local resources from around the house, display this pinnacle of youthful creativity with pride.
Uni-Can Do It Teddy! Kid's Sculpture

Does your child aspire to be the Leader of the Pirates? There's no better crew than Teddy's! With its one good eye, Teddy can sail all the blue seas with only the best captain by its side. A new world of adventure awaits, and maybe some pieces of treasure along the way.
Far out! Looks like we have a future astronaut in our midst. It may not be up to snuff compared to the Steampunk Flyamajig, but it's certainly a start.

Wilson? Wait, no...that's Teddy! Cast off into a sea of mayhem with Teddy's state-of-the-art raft, beautifully crafted by today's youth. Can Teddy survive the rocky seas with nothing but a shovel and grit? Only time, and a little imagination, will tell!
Does your Splash Pad need some more flower power fun? This is the sculpture for you!

Real trees drop leaves, which can be a problem for splash pads. Nobody likes old wet moldy leaves underfoot! This sculpture is shady and adds to the aesthetic of any splash pad area, but it won't shed leaves! So it really is a win-win sort of sculpture.
Who likes the sun? Not me! This shady shelter makes sure you don't have to look directly at it, because that's bad for eyes!

Now you can have your very own Whalebert! Based off of San Sequoia's beloved neighborhood Whalebert, this backyard friend comes in a variety of fun colors and is ready to lounge in your personal splash pad play area.
Your bike's got a problem? This handy repair kit has what you need to get rolling again!

The ultimate collection of board games that every home needs. Air on the side of caution: board games may lead to happy memories, jokes that last a lifetime, or strained friendships. No stealing from the money pile!
San Sequoia is a foggy place...Who better to navigate the foreboding, obscured straight leading into the bay than Captain Gnome?

Did you know that many species of owl have ears at different heights on their head in order to more accurately locate where sounds are coming from? Super useful for catching tonight's dinner. Also useful for catching wind of any mischief tiny owlets get into. It's like a built in baby monitor!
Honestly, art makes the world go around! Interestingly enough, you know what also helps people get around? No? The answer is horses! Go figure.

Sure, a child's desk is nothing compared to the emerald hills of a distant fantasy land, bathed in luxurious sunshine and peppered with a spectrum of wildflower blooms, whose scent gets carried on the velvet breeze. And I mean, the company of a child isn't quite the same as a flaxen-haired elven princess adorned in the finest jewels of her land, closely attuned with nature as she strides the aforementioned hills, befriending the wildlife. But for what it's worth, this unicorn isn't complaining... yet!

Take a deep breath, parents! The mess is just a part of the artistic process. It's just some spilled craft glue, and the paint is (mostly) washable. And look how cute that little toilet paper roll monster is! Louvre-worthy, if you ask me.
We had a joke about jigsaw puzzles ready for this but we just couldn't piece it together. After being passed down from family to family, we can't promise that all of the pieces are in the box.
Cities are so cool, you know? Show off a mini skyline so your home can be cool too.

One of my favorite parts about Cable Cars is that they all have really cool names! It really gives it personality. I added this one to give my room some of that personality, and it's named...huh it's smudged...
Hey, watch out! This taxi is parked here, and you won't be able to put anything else down until it decides to leave. Considering it's a statue, that might take a while—best to go around.

Can you feel it? The supreme creative soul emanating from this tiny art? When the house is majorly lacking colorful decoration, it's great when the kids start chippin' in! Even though these works of art were made by tiny hands, they're a thing of beauty, which we know will never fade away (at least in our hearts!)

A historical display of Fishing Lures that is part of San Sequoia's fishing industry history. This collection originally belonged to Bayani Robles, a local fisherman-turned-entrepreneur. To this day, the Robles family is still very much entrenched in the area, and you won't find more expert fishers!
San Sequoia Fishing Lure Display Case
This hand towel isn't just here for show, everyone! If you go to the bathroom, wash your hands. The towel is here to remind you to do that.
Here for a Reason Hand Towel
How many times am I going to have to tell these kids that they need to hang their wet towels? The hooks are right there! Maybe if I put them there, the rest of the house will get the message...
A certificate of marriage, officially stating your marital status.
School drawings created on the first day of Grade School.
A cast of your baby's handprint from when they were a Newborn.

Sure, family hand-me-downs aren't the most ideal, but at least some of your mom's old furniture comes in sets. Pairing well with the Hallway Table, this cabinet can hold and hide all the knick knacks you don't want people to see. And yes, it is as heavy as it looks, but that's what makes it sturdy!

What's more comforting to a little one than a soft doll? Show off the cutest cloth dolls and store some more of the many, many toys your kids have collected in a short amount of time. Where did they even all come from?

It sure was nice of your family to take such good care of these suitcases to pass down to you, but they don't even have wheels! What's the point? Give these vintage suitcases a new life as some shelves and have more places to show off your stuff.

Update the classics with some new hardware. Give that shower and bathtub combo a facelift with some new tile, an upgraded shower head, and a bamboo tray to keep the whole thing tidy. Get clean in modern comfort.
The perfect, generic sign for any business or community place! Flowers add a touch of warmth and cheeriness.

The perfect sign for the local Recreation Center! The waterfall adds a touch of calm that says: this is a place you'll find both rest and relaxation. And the little running person says: you'll get your body moving! That...or you'll have to chase the kids all over.

Oh, that sign outside? Yeah, Jennie drew it on her bre- wait a second, did you just call it a "chalk sign" as if it's some run-of-the-mill sign? As if we didn't draw it using the finest fresh, all-natural chalk? Let me guess, if you had to draw a sign like that, you'd be the type of person to use "chalk" that wasn't made of ultra-finely milled carbonate mineral sourced exclusively from the outskirts of the Oasis Springs mesa? Ugh...

There are so many things to do at a Recreation Center! This sign decorates an area and helps "say" what an area is for without any real words. An area for art? Add the easel picture. A changing room? Add the hanger! There's a sign for every space.
Want your home to have all the rustic charm of an old family farm but feel more modern? Add form to function for an elevated handwashing and teeth-brushing experience.

Pull up a seat and let's talk! This barstool is the perfect addition to any bar or high countertop that will be the home of drinks, snacks, and—of course—some steaming hot gossip. It'll support you as you lean in towards your friend and say, "that's terrible! Keep going."

Enough! ENOUGH ALREADY! The complaints have still been piling in since v.2 dropped. Fine, we give up. You wanted more cushioning? THE WHOLE CHAIR IS A CUSHION NOW! Please, stop sending so many complaints to Kindermade HQ. How about instead, you all go Kinder-make yourself some friends, or get a hobby, or something.
Dining is Groovy! v.3 by Kindermade

Having heard the complaints of buyers and their dinner guests alike, Kindermade went with a slightly more comfortable iteration for the second edition of the "Dining is Groovy!" KinderMod line. Of course, we wouldn't want to spoil anyone with a cushy, magical sitting experience. Your guests might stay too long and drink all your finest juice! It's no longer a solid block of material, but the angles will certainly become abrasive after a few hours.
Dining is Groovy! v.2 by Kindermade

Yes, you're looking at the official "The Nomad" Chair from world-renowned designer Aldo Caldo. He notably carried one of these chairs tied to his back across an entire continent. His trek started in the desert right outside of Oasis Springs and ended on the peak of Mt. Komorebi, where a crowd (as big as his ego) consisting of reporters and fans eagerly awaited his arrival. It was just as insufferable as you can imagine.

Eschew comfort in favor of totally radical vibes, with perhaps the most daring of Kindermade's KinderMod pieces. This chair will ensure your dinner guests will be both wowed by your exquisite aesthetics and hesitant to overstay their welcome, for fear of having to sit longer on such a non-ergonomic surface!
Dining is Groovy! v.1 by Kindermade

Here at Woven Whims, we believe that the luxury that comes with furniture weaving belongs in every room in the home. Our deluxe dining chairs brings elegance and comfort to one of the most used rooms in your house. Once you sit on one of these chairs, you'll never accept anything else.
Deluxe Dining Chair by Woven Whims

My, what eggs-elent taste you have in chairs! Cast off the yolk of everyday monotony and have a seat on this luxurious living chair, as you bask in whatever form of hen-tertainment piques your interest.

Among the newest additions to Kindermade's KinderMod collection, it's a chair that respects and protects your privacy! You wouldn't just let anyone read your secret Social Bunny post drafts, right? Or your scandalous texts that contain questionable opinions about cowplants? No! So have a seat, and type in peace.

With a style the world has never seen baa-fore, and an un-herd of level of softness, Sims everywhere wool-d love be the proud owners of this chair! Its sturdy frame is safe to be used by even the most ram-bunctious little lambs. They'll love this chair so much that your usual call of "come inside, it's pasture bedtime" won't fill them with shear dread at the thought of another boring night at home!

Sure, the cushions are all lumpy. The leather upholstery has mostly lost its shine. And there's definitely a grandpa-shaped imprint on it from (many, many) years of continued use. But it's still a chair! And as grandpa always says, if it ain't broke, don't fix it!

We've provided you posterior venting solutions in the form of slatted stools and dining chairs, but now you can vent your posterior in style, together! For those of you whose buns get a little too warm, but love to sit in pairs, no longer will you insulate your behind with the heat of another! The vents of justice prevail.

When we held our quarterly board meeting to identify ways to appeal to today's younger generation (titled: "Whatever you say, consumer! Ok, consumer!"), our goal was to make this the most snatched rocking chair we've ever made. That's right, this rocking chair slaps! Sheeeeeeesh! The soft fabric really hits different, doesn't it! High-key this chair is looking like a snack! And if you don't buy it? Well that's a big yikes from me...

Rocking around at the speed of sound? Forget that, with The WhipperSnapper: Mach 10 Edition you'll be rocking at ten times the speed of sound, guaranteed. This ain't a joke folks, it's in the name! Make those youngsters' heads spin as you reach rocking speeds they could only dream of. Because back in your day, rocking chairs moved at speeds faster than human comprehension, right? Talk about a blast from the past!

Calling all hens! Looking for the perfect spot to nest with your friends as you hatch a plan for brunch on Sunday? Look no further than this egg-ceptional seating option! It'll be worth every Simolean you shell out.
Newer doesn't always mean better. This sofa has that lived-in feel, meaning your naps and movie marathons are going to feel just right.

The most classic of Splash Pad emitters! It may be simple, but it's certainly not lacking in fun!\n\nFor Use: Place this emitter (or as many as you'd like) onto any of the various Splash Pads to create your own Splash Pad play area.

It's round! And everyone knows that round is the most fun of all shapes. Play ball! Or Splash Pad...technically. \n\nFor Use: Place this emitter (or as many as you'd like) onto any of the various Splash Pads to create your own Splash Pad play area.

A mushroom emitter is particularly fun because the overhang lets all the water fall down over you! What is more fun than that? (Don't tell, but it's our favorite of the Splash Pad emitters. Even if round shapes are pretty fun.) \n\nFor Use: Place this emitter (or as many as you'd like) onto any of the various Splash Pads to create your own Splash Pad play area.

This Splash Pad might be small, but doesn't that make it more approachable? And think of how well it'll fit into the backyard!\n\nFor Use: Place a single Splash Pad for some simple backyard fun OR mix and match to create your own, unique Splash Pad play area! Add emitters and let the water fun begin!

Some Splash Pads are just a little too big and some are just a little too small—but this one is perfect for some family-friendly afternoon fun. \n\nFor Use: Place a single Splash Pad for some simple backyard fun OR mix and match to create your own, unique Splash Pad play area! Add emitters and let the water fun begin!

Just think of all of the emitters you could fit on a Splash Pad of this size! There will be room for the whole family to run around and play in the water. \n\nFor Use: Place a single Splash Pad for some simple backyard fun OR mix and match to create your own, unique Splash Pad play area! Add emitters and let the water fun begin!

This rounded speaker has some incredible sound quality for being so small. Your house party will have the perfect soundtrack, you'll be able to add some white noise to a quiet house, and whatever else you could want with a speaker. The best part? No one will miss out on whatever's playing.
This wall-mounted stereo is intended for use at community venues. Relax to the catchy rhythms and vocals of Soul music.
No one really knows when this stove hood was first made, but it looks brand new, doesn't it? It'll fit perfectly in your kitchen.
Take the design of the stove your nana would have used, but add a dash of modern technology. Put it together and you'll have the perfect statement piece for your kitchen that will be useful to boot.
Just like Nana Used to Make Stove

Going someplace? Bring this suitcase! With all your clothes close at hand, stored in style, you'll never be left without a smile during your trip away from home. Or, in this case, simply display your suitcase proudly to make sure everyone knows you are a cool family that travels soooooo often.

If your child is on the right track, this backpack will help them stay on it! It's the perfect size for a weekend stay over with the grandparents. It can hold all the clothes your child will need, with just enough space for their favorite stuffed animal too, of course!
Everyone knows that there is nothing like swinging in the outdoor sun as kid growing up. While you can still swing as an adult, many could argue it's just not the same.
Do you ever see a big piece of wood and think "if I add some resin, this would make a cute table?" Well, someone did, and now you can put all your belongings on it!

Was your grandma a librarian? Who needs tiny drawers like this besides librarians? Not to worry, it's still sturdy as can be, and will make a very cute table. Don't bother trying to use the drawers for all your tiny cards, though. They haven't opened in years.
Not Your Grandma's Drawers, Your Table

Dining tables are never just dining tables. It's a place for your chosen family to gather and help with homework, use a laptop, and of course, family meals. There's nowhere quite like a Family Table to spend quality time together.

Who could've guessed that the funkiest, freshest dining experience known to man could be born from boardroom discussions in the heart of Kindermade HQ? This table doesn't just deliver a delightful aesthetic, it's scientifically proven to deliver a better life! Kindermade employees reported that their government-mandated lunch breaks were (approximately) 3% more fun when they sat at these tables. The numbers don't lie!

This dining table is perfect for a spot of...well, anything! A spot of tea, a spot of your favorite meal, even homework. The best part is with no corners, you'll feel closer than ever to the people you're sharing with.
Some wood someone found + resin = a stylish end table that's perfect for a lamp or some books.

End tables can be so basic sometimes, but this one right here? This one is attention-worthy. With those rounded edges and finish options? Wow...how could you not want something like that holding a lamp in your home?
A timeless piece that will look good anywhere and will hold just about whatever you need it to.

This game table is the bees knees! Pull up a few of Kindermade's "Dining is Groovy!" chairs (any version) and you're ready to host the niftiest game (or puzzle!) night ever held. I mean, any chair works, but we here at Kindermade are contractually obligated by management to say tha- ahem... we sincerely recommend it!

If your family has been saving things for generations, you're going to need somewhere to put it all. This hallway table can hold pictures, statues, and whatever other decorations you've collected over the years.

Every picnic is a dream, but traditional picnic seating offers very little posterior venting, and heavens forbid we let those buns to get a too musty! Ruin your picnics no more with our elegant outdoor dining solution. Have your cake, and air it out too!

This box looks like it once belonged to your great great great...great grandmother. Who knows how long ago the edges started to show their wear, but one thing that is for certain is that this toy box has seen much love over its time.
This cute companion will entertain your little ones to their hearts' desires. Yes, it's noisy, but it's cute and makes kids happy. What else matters?
Unlocked by reaching Bronze and above in a Baby Shower event.
An ear-resistable rattle that your little ones will have a hoppin' good time with! Comes in an a-bun-dance of pastel colors that will brighten up any play area.
Unlocked by reaching Silver and above in a Baby Shower event.

Are used diapers amassing a whale of a stale smell at a scale that's beyond the pale every time you inhale, making you wail? Well, your luck will prevail! Every other diaper pail pales in comparison to this holy grail of pails, now on sale! And it doesn't even entail ordering it via mail! It's right here, without fail. Walk a happier trail and live to tell the tale with this diaper pail!

Chop chop, it's time to get to work so your children can climb, play make believe, and nap to their hearts' content!\n\nObjects that can be placed on the Treehouse balcony can be found by searching "Placeable on Treehouse" in the Buy menu.

Throw these twinkly little guys onto your treehouse? You're ready for fun, and no need for sun!

What goes up to the treehouse, must come down from the treehouse. Conveniently, both can be done via this slide!

Located in a quiet neighborhood, this lot boasts a lovely view of the marina and bay shoreline. A small park with fishing, a pirate ship playset, and a unique monument is only a stone's throw away.

This cozy starter is tucked away in Hopewell Hills' spacious, breezy, suburban neighborhood. With ample yard space available, there's room for plenty of outdoor entertaining. But if all of that space isn't enough, there's literally a small park and a fishing pond right next door.

This modern addition to the neighborhood has a lot of curb appeal and plenty to love on the inside, too. Nested within the suburban, tree-filled neighborhood that was developed originally by Gilbert Gilberts, 36 Bayani Place has Dream home written all over it. The street name itself is an homage to Bayani Robles, whose statue is located within the adjacent park.

Between the gorgeous bay views and the beautiful, tree-lined streets in this neighborhood, this house has a lot to offer a growing family looking for a more upscale feel to things. Enjoy spacious living inside, or take the fun outside in the large, well-appointed yard with plenty for any family member to do—but if you're looking for even more opportunities to get in touch with nature, a park with a small pond is nearby.

This lot's perfectly situated at the edge of Gilbert Gardens park with the Celebration Center close by. There's no such thing as a bad view here; you have the lake in one direction and the bay in another!

This cozy home is perfect for a small family who still want a bit of space for themselves, and with a backyard that's already treehouse-friendly, you're already set for plenty of outdoors fun! Gilbert Gardens is just across the street so you can look forward to grilling up a meal to enjoy at the gazebo or just taking a dip in the lake. If quiet is what your family is looking for, you've certainly found it!

The Celebration Center offers a little something for everyone. There's a gym space to get in that extra workout with friends, an artist's corner to paint or create, a music room to play instruments or sing with friends, and an area for Elders to gather and play chess, Simbles, or more.

Looking to corner the market on cozy living with your first home? This starter features unique modern accents and a quiet patio area that's just right for your BBQ gatherings or quiet reflection. You won't be in the thick of noise or people in this neighborhood, but you'll still have plenty of activity around you at Gilbert Gardens.

This plot of land is right at the center of all of Anchorpoint Wharf's action. It is perfectly poised location between the duality of the area: the calm, serenity of a lovely ocean view and the bustle of its historic downtown area. Best of all, the library is right across the way, so whoever lives here can stop by and pick up a good book anytime.

Stop by and unwind with a good book. Or a bad book; no one will judge you here! This family-friendly library is the perfect place to curl up with a good book in a cozy corner, get some work done on a computer, or create your own story time for children in our special children's area.

When Bayani Robles first purchased this plot of land and began building Robles Point, he surely never envisioned the legacy his family has gone on to have! This house has had many changes and additions over the year, but it all adds to the home's character and shows that Anchorpoint Wharf is an ever-evolving area where the old and the new come together.

Looking for a luxe vacation spot on the wharf that checks every box? Anchorpoint Abode is a traveler's dream, with ample amenities (including a hot tub!) and a view that you just can't beat. Hope you're up for a little shark-watching while you're at it.
Kyle's just, like, a guy, okay?

The Luna-Sullivan family's a little unusual; Karmine's dad died in a tragic cooking accident, and her mom needed help...so Gramma Eleanor moved in to be the Gramma-in-charge-ish. Except Gramma's just as silly as Karmine is!

Celeste and Christopher met working at the same startup. They couldn't believe how much they had in common when they first went out for coffee together! After they got married, they adopted Atlas and promptly began spoiling him rotten. Now they've also adopted Orion and are hard at work raising two kids to be just as nerdy as they are.

The Robles family is pretty entrenched in this community—they've been here ever since the fishing trade started taking off, and for years had a thriving family business. Ignacio's the patriarch of this family, but just because they have deep roots doesn't make them all that conventional. They know everyone and anyone, and love being a part of everything this community has to offer—from spending way too much of their free time down by the waterfront to organizing big family gatherings at Gilbert Gardens park.

The Robles-Ruano Family is a bit on the unconventional side, but being conventional is soooo boring, right? These folks are all about expressing themselves and their personality no matter what. Both parents are hoping that their unique ways will rub off on their slightly clingy daughter, Tala. With a little love, Tala is sure to grow into a confident (and creative!) kid.

San Sequoia began as a small fishing town, then became a hub of the fishing and canning industry due to the influence of local fisherman-turned-entrepreneur, Bayani Robles. The Robles family is still very much entrenched in the area even as it has expanded over time thanks to Gilbert Gilberts. Today, San Sequoia is home to cozy streets, a beautiful park with gardens, and quiet suburban neighborhoods. It's the perfect place to raise a family!

Close family members are tight-knit and have a very strong relationship. These Sims will naturally gravitate towards each other, and develop strong positive sentiments more easily when spending time together! When socializing, they will share Deep Thoughts with each other more often.

When Sims have a Strict family dynamic, the younger Sim in the relationship respects the authority of the older Sim. The younger Sim often meets the high expectations set for them, though they often feel stressed around the older Sim. When socializing, the older Sim will often demand more of the younger Sim, and the younger Sim will usually play it safe with Small Talk.

When Sims have a Difficult family dynamic, they simply don't get along like most other family members. When socializing, they will usually lean toward Complaints, or even Mean interactions. They will also be more likely to form Furious sentiments towards each other.

Sims with a Distant family dynamic tend to be more reserved when around each other, and won't make particularly frequent contact when apart. Even when in the same household, they won't go out of their way to interact or spend time together. If they do have to speak, they'll both naturally lean towards Small Talk. They also have a higher chance of forming Bitter sentiments towards each other.

Sims with the Jokesters family dynamic are often cracking jokes with one another, and really know how to make each other laugh! When socializing, they'll often naturally lean toward Funny interactions, especially Jokes. They might even get up to some Mischief together! They're more likely to form Close or Hurt sentiments towards each other.

When Sims have a Supportive family dynamic, the older Sim often provides the younger Sim with emotional support and reassurance, while serving as a good role model for the younger Sim. When socializing, both Sims will actively seek to provide Affection and Compliments to each other, the older Sim will actively seek to console or cheer up the younger Sim, and the younger Sim feels comfortable venting their Complaints or asking for help a bit more.

When Sims have a Supportive family dynamic, the older Sim often provides the younger Sim with emotional support and reassurance, while serving as a good role model for the younger Sim. When socializing, both Sims will actively seek to provide Affection and Compliments to each other, the older Sim will actively seek to console or cheer up the younger Sim, and the younger Sim feels comfortable venting their Complaints or asking for help a bit more.

Sims with a Permissive family dynamic tend to let things slide when the younger Sim gets into a bit of trouble. The older Sim will often shower the younger Sim in Affection and Compliments, while the younger Sim will tend to be more demanding. They're more likely to form Adoring sentiments towards each other.

Sims with High Confidence have learned to believe in themselves. They become confident more easily, even when learning from mistakes. However, they can still be hurt when criticized. High Confidence becomes High Self-Esteem when aging into a teen.\n\nA child Sim's confidence level can increase or decrease depending on skill gain, school performance, positive and negative socialization, succeeding or failing or skill-based activities, confident or embarrassed moods, and more. Caregivers criticizing or praising a child's behavior also impacts their confidence levels.

Sims with Low Confidence are at higher risk of receiving a Fear of Being Inferior, they get stressed when losing confidence, and they become embarrassed when a caregiver criticizes them. Support means everything to these Sims. If not addressed, Low Confidence becomes Low Self-Esteem when aging into a teen.\n\nA child Sim's confidence level can increase or decrease depending on skill gain, school performance, positive and negative socialization, succeeding or failing or skill-based activities, confident or embarrassed moods, and more. Caregivers criticizing or praising a child's behavior also impacts their confidence levels.

Sims with Neutral Confidence are still figuring out how they feel about their own capabilities. They can be easily encouraged or discouraged when gaining or losing confidence. A Sim with Neutral Confidence will have neither High nor Low Self-Esteem when aging into a teen.\n\nA child Sim's confidence level can increase or decrease depending on skill gain, school performance, positive and negative socialization, succeeding or failing or skill-based activities, confident or embarrassed moods, and more. Caregivers criticizing or praising a child's behavior also impacts their confidence levels.
(From Completing the Mind and Body Aspiration)

This Infant hiccups all the time. Infants with this Quirk have more gas in their tummy and hiccup more frequently.
This Infant is always sneezing. Infants with this Quirk clear their little noses of particles and germs more frequently. It's perfectly normal and healthy!
This Infant has tummy issues. Infants with this Quirk will be gassier and fussier.
This Infant loves to eat. Infants with this Quirk will always accept the opportunity to feed, and they'll finish almost any food, regardless of how hungry they are.
This Infant is prone to spitting up while they feed. Infants with this Quirk are perfectly normal—their digestive systems are just still maturing.
This Infant doesn't like to be held. Infants with this Quirk are more likely to get upset when they're picked up and happier to be set down.
This Infant rarely wakes up in a good mood. Infants with this Quirk are more likely to behave like grumpy bunnies when they wake up from a nap or sleep.
This Infant loves to be held. Infants with this Quirk are more likely to react positively when they're picked up or carried and upset when they're put down.
This Infant is often bright and sunny upon awaking. Infants with this Quirk are more likely to be happy when they wake up.
This Infant is extra messy around food time. Infants with this Quirk are more likely to get food all over themselves and the High Chair.
This Infant loves to hear sounds. Infants with this Quirk love to do anything that makes a sound, and they're more likely to wiggle when music is playing nearby.

This Infant only likes to fall asleep when they're being held. Infants with this Quirk cry when they're put down to sleep, even if they've been soothed. They prefer to sleep while being held or in a back carrier.

This Infant often pees during diaper changes. Infants with this Quirk are more sensitive to the air temperature in the room during diaper changes, which results in them peeing frequently during them. Watch out!
This Infant often pees while being fed. Infants with this Quirk are more likely to use their diaper during feedings.

This Infant is very particular about food. Infants with this Quirk are more likely to reject feedings unless they're hungry. They also aren't likely to finish their food unless they love it, regardless of how hungry they are.
This Infant prefers to rise with the sun. Infants with this Quirk are more likely to wake up when the sun comes up.

This Infant will often try to self-soothe {0.SimPronounReflexive}. Infants with this Quirk are more likely to place their fingers and toes in their mouths to calm themselves when sad or angry, and especially when crying.
This Infant is very talkative. Infants with this Quirk are more likely to coo and babble both to themselves and others.

This Toddler is a little more aggressive than most. Toddlers with this Quirk like to roughhouse and are quick to hit, bite, or kick Sims (so long as they aren't good friends). They don't even have to be angry. Watch out!
This Toddler loves anything that makes sounds. Toddlers with this Quirk tend to be fascinated with radios, TVs, and toys that make sounds.
This Toddler loves books. Toddlers with this Quirk enjoy playing around bookshelves and are more likely to do book-related activities when able.
This Toddler is often destructive. Uh oh! Toddlers with this Quirk often behave like little monsters who take pleasure in the chaos they leave behind in their wake!
This Toddler prefers to rise with the sun. Toddlers with this Quirk are more likely to wake up when the sun comes up.

This Toddler is always ready for food. Toddlers with this Quirk love to eat, which can make mealtime easier. But be careful! These little ones have been known to eat food off of the floor... even if it's spoiled.
This Toddler hates bedtime and naptime. Toddlers with this Quirk tend to wake up shortly after falling asleep and will often ask their caregiver for various things to avoid sleeping.

This Toddler hates to be carried! Toddlers with this Quirk can manage on their own, thank you very much. Caregivers should be careful picking this toddler up as it will likely put the toddler in a bad mood.
This Toddler rarely wakes up in a good mood. Toddlers with this Quirk are more likely to behave like grumpy bunnies when they wake up from a nap or sleep.
This Toddler is a heavy sleeper. Toddlers with this Quirk won't wake up from surrounding noises, are less likely to wake up from nightmares, and have an easier time getting good rest.
This Toddler is a light sleeper. Toddlers who are light sleepers have a tendency to wake up randomly when sleeping and will need to be put back to sleep if they're still tired.

This Toddler loves to be held. Toddlers with this Quirk love to be carried and especially love it when their Caregivers are the ones doing so. They're also more likely to ask to be picked up when they haven't been carried in a while.
This Toddler is often bright and sunny upon awaking. Toddlers with this Quirk are more likely to be happy when they wake up compared to other Toddlers.
This Toddler is a little extra-messy around food time. Toddlers with this Quirk are more likely to cause messes when eating their food.
This Toddler is very particular about food. Toddlers with this Quirk regularly refuse food that's given to them and will even toss it from time-to-time. What a mess!
This Toddler frequent wanders off. Toddlers with this Quirk are quick to run away after they're put down.
This Toddler loves to sing. Toddlers with this Quirk enjoy singing and tend to sing at random times throughout the day.
This Toddler loves to play in and around water. Toddlers with this Quirk are more likely to do things like splash in toilets, ask to take baths, and seek out other activities involving water.
These Sims regularly become confident, even when failing to gain skills or succeed at work. They are also less likely to develop a fear of failure.
These Sims become tense when they fail to gain skills or don't succeed in their career. They are also at high risk of developing a fear of failure.

Back Carriers are the perfect accessory for on-the-go families with Infants. It frees up the hands of Teen and older Sims to do a variety of activities, including holding another Infant or Toddler!\n\nYou can choose from a variety of colors by selecting Set Preferred Back Carrier on an Infant, in the Baby Care category of the interaction pie menu.

Sims with Neutral Confidence are still figuring out how they feel about their own capabilities. They can be easily encouraged or discouraged when gaining or losing confidence. A Sim with Neutral Confidence will have neither High nor Low Self-Esteem when aging into a teen.

All Children Sims have a Confidence Level. Confidence begins in a Neutral state but may become High or Low throughout a Sim's childhood. Having High or Low Confidence will impact a Child's mood, and the effects may have a long-term affect on Self-Esteem throughout their lives.

A child Sim's confidence level can increase or decrease depending on skill gain, school performance, positive and negative socialization, succeeding or failing in skill-based activities, confident or embarrassed moods, and more. Caregivers criticizing or praising a child's behavior also impacts their confidence levels.

A Child's current Confidence Level is visible as a Temporary Trait in the Simology Panel.

Sims with Low Confidence are at higher risk of receiving a Fear of Being Inferior, they get stressed when losing confidence, and they become embarrassed when a caregiver criticizes them. Support means everything to these Sims. If not addressed, Low Confidence becomes Low Self-Esteem when aging into a teen.

Sims with High Confidence have learned to believe in themselves. They become confident more easily, even when learning from mistakes. However, they can still be hurt when criticized. High Confidence becomes High Self-Esteem when aging into a teen.

Conversation Topic preferences can be selected from the Likes and Dislikes section in CAS. Liking a Conversation Topic indicates that your Sim enjoys having other Sims interact with them in that way. Disliking a Conversation Topic means your Sim will likely reject that type of interaction when another Sim performs it. For example, if your Sim Dislikes Gossip, they will most likely respond negatively when another Sim tries to Gossip with them. But that won't stop them from being able to perform Gossip interactions towards another Sim.

Note that each Conversation Topic corresponds to a different subcategory of interactions available in the Pie Menu when interacting with other Sims. Upon learning another Sim's Conversation Topic preferences, you can easily find the types of interactions they enjoy hearing (and avoid the ones they don't!)

Family Dynamics between two Sims in a household can be set in Create A Sim under the Household Relationships panel. They can also be discovered naturally in Live Mode based on experiences those Sims have together.\n\nTo remove an existing Family Dynamic between your Sim and a family member, your Sim can purchase the Dynamic-No-More Potion from the Rewards Store. Sims might also discover that their dynamic has changed in Live Mode based on how their relationship develops with their family members!

The Keepsake Box is not only a great place to keep your family mementos, but can also be used to change the Family Dynamic between two Sims. This item can be found in Build Mode, and must be designated as the family keepsake by an Elder Sim to be used. Once that’s completed, Sims can Ponder the Meaning of Family.

Family Dynamics define the relationship between two family members, revealing how they'll feel and act when around each other. Different familial relationships allow for different types of dynamics to be set. Once two Sims have a dynamic, you'll notice them receiving unique buffs when spending time together, and autonomously choosing interactions that suit the nature of their dynamic.

Infants and Toddlers are unique! In addition to traits, each Infant and Toddler starts off with a total of three hidden Quirks. These Quirks affect how the Sim will behave during their current age and will be discovered automatically when the affected behavior occurs. Visit the Trait Section of the Simology panel to review these Quirks after they've been discovered.

Caregivers can now change diapers for Infant and Toddler Sims by using the Changing Table! Different Changing Tables can be purchased directly from Build Buy mode with or without a Diaper Pail attached. If an Infant Sim is left with a dirty diaper for too long they can get a diaper rash.

Infants can learn through play by interacting with the Playmat. Caregivers can bond with an Infant by playing or socializing with an Infant Sim on the Playmat. As your Infant progress towards milestones, they will eventually be able to play alone and show off new surprising behaviors. Try running Tummy Time Together to help your Infant Sim unlock milestones faster!

Infant Milestones are celebrated moments where Infant Sims experience life and develop capabilities as they learn and grow. Some Infant Milestones come from natural development or socialization, while others can be progressed through Milestone-specific interactions. Like regular Milestones, Infant Milestones are about the journey of raising an Infant.\n\nInfants can achieve Firsts, Life, Social, Gross Motor, and Fine Motor Milestones.

While all Sims can achieve Social Milestones, Infant Social Milestones help them develop emotionally and verbally. These Milestones will allow them to better express themselves and build relationships with other Sims. The more Social Milestones they unlock as an Infant, the more advanced their Toddler Communication skill becomes.\n\nHave other Sims run Friendly interactions with the Infant to get started! As they progress, Infants can start to verbally respond to other Sims, toys, stuffed animals, and even when trying new food.

Achieving Gross Motor Milestones allow Infants to develop the muscles in their body for whole body movement and coordination. The more Gross Motor Milestones they unlock as an Infant, the more advanced their Toddler Movement skill becomes. To start, all Infants depend on other Sims for mobility, so progressing through these Milestones will affect how your Infant can get around by themselves. Once they learn to Sit Up, they can scoot around nearby. After learning how to crawl, your Infant will get a taste of independence and excitement for what the world has to offer! Have a caregiver practice Tummy Time Together found in the Activities category under Friendly interactions to start with the basics. As they achieve more Milestones, they will unlock more interactions targeted to practicing and strengthening their muscles!

Achieving Fine Motor Milestones allow Infants to strengthen smaller muscles for more controlled and precise movements in their hands. These Milestones affect how they interact with toys and food in the High-Chair. The more Fine Motor Milestones they unlock as an Infant, the more advanced their Toddler Thinking skill becomes.\n\nUsing the Way-to-Play Playmat is a great way to start building up those tiny muscles. After learning the basics, playing with toybox toys, nesting blocks, and dollhouses will help further them along.

As you progress through Infant Milestones, you will unlock new behaviors and interactions for Infants and Caregivers. For example, as Infants progress in their Gross Motor milestones they'll gain the Fun Need, which opens up new possibilities with various play objects to keep your Infant happy.\n\nIf you can achieve the more advanced Infant Milestones, your Infant can get a head start on their Toddler skills when they age up.

Once a Midlife Crisis has started Sims will have various desires to fulfill, which can be found in the Aspirations panel. Desires are optional, but completion of desires will help decrease the duration of the crisis. Once a desire has been completed it is replaced with a new desire. After a number of desires have been completed the Sim's Midlife Crisis will end.

Adult sims might get a midlife crisis that will last for a period of time and will have an impact on what the Sim wants to do. This will manifest in a variety of four different types of Midlife Crisis.

Depending on where your Sim is in life, Revealable Milestones may show up in the Simology Panel to give you clues on how to achieve them.\n\nFrom learning fundamentals as an Infant to retiring from their career as an Elder, Sims reach Milestones throughout their lives. Have your Sim experience new things and see what you can achieve!

All Sims can achieve Firsts, Life, and Social Milestones, while Toddlers and Infants have additional categories related to learning and development. \n\nThe Simology Panel will show recently completed Milestones for your Sim's current age. When a Sim completes a Milestone, it will appear under the appropriate category. Hovering over the Icon will tell you information about the Milestone. Clicking View Milestones will show completed Milestones throughout all of your Sim's life.

Milestones track key moments in your Sim's life, allowing you to reminisce on their journey. Think of Milestones as a collection of experiences rather than an achievement list. Your Sim isn't required to complete them all.\n\nAchieving certain Milestones can affect your Sim's behavior and mood, reward special memorabilia, and unlock new interactions.

Self Discovery trait moments will appear based on the activities and recent life experiences of the Sim. These moments are completely optional, and can be embraced or declined. Self Discovery moments can be turned off for all Sims in the Game Options panel.

Young Adults through Elders can have a moment of Self Discovery where they may find a new trait that is suitable for them. In these Self Discovery moments Sims will be presented with a new Personality Trait or potentially recommended a Personality Trait to swap with an existing one if the two traits conflict. Through Self Discovery Sims will be able to embrace up to 3 Discovery Moments.

When meeting other Sims, the Sim Characteristic Likes and Dislikes your Sim has selected will be compiled into a Social Compatibility that falls into one of five levels: Awful, Bad, Neutral, Good, or Amazing Compatibility. This compatibility score takes the Sim Characteristic Likes and Dislikes of both Sims into account!\n\nWhen your Sim has compatibilities that aren't Neutral, you can see them for each Sim in the Relationships panel in Live Mode. Sims with better compatibility will find it much easier to become friends, while worse compatibility will present a considerable challenge for developing that relationship.

Sim Characteristic preferences can be selected from the Likes and Dislikes section in CAS. Each type corresponds to a category other Sims might fall into based on their traits, Likes and Dislikes for Activities, and other aspects of their personality they might have gained during their life.\n\nFor example, the Homebody category includes Sims with traits like Loner or Bookworm, but also Sims that Like Writing or Like Cooking. Liking and Disliking a wide range of different Sim Characteristics will lead to more variation in compatibility with other Sims!

Puzzles can be selected from a number of categories and can vary in difficulty, depending on the size of the puzzle selected. Nearby Sims are able to join in the fun, or sit and socialize as well. Completed Puzzles can even be framed as wall art!\n\nThere is also a Custom Puzzle by Reference option that allows Sims to take a capture of something nearby, and then put together a puzzle of that image!

The Celebration Center in Gilbert Gardens hosts a variety of new social activities for Sims to engage in! On the game tables there, you'll find a new tile game called Simbles, as well as Puzzles. These can also be found on game tables purchased in Build Mode. Several walking paths are available across the park that friends and families can walk on together, taking in the views of the park.

There are 3 paths in Gilbert Gardens that Sims can walk together on or by themselves. These can be started via the signs marking the head of the trail. \n\nUse Jog and Powerwalk options for a little exercise and fitness, or take a reflective walk for something more casual.
A planned or currently running Stay Over can be cancelled at any time via the Calendar.

Stay Overs can be initiated from the Calendar, Phone, or Relationship Panel. It's a good idea to double check the guest list and duration prior to confirming your plans. There might also be times when another Sim outside of your Sim's household calls to arrange a Stay Over!\n\nDuring the Stay Over, guests can be asked to help around the house, or simply relax during their stay. The choice is yours!

Stay Overs are a new type of event that involve family or friends sleeping over at your Sim's house for a set period of time. Since these can last multiple days, it's a good idea to make sure visiting Sims have a place to sleep!\n\nOnly one Stay Over can be active for a household at any time. Other events, such as birthday parties or weddings, can be held during a Stay Over! Planning a Stay Over is a great way to tell stories involving guests arriving a few days early for a big event.

Sims can now build the treehouse of their dreams! To get started, your Sim can purchase a treehouse base in Build Mode like the Timber! Treehouse Base. Upon purchasing the base, any Sim aged Teen or older can begin building the treehouse. Once building starts, any Sim from Child age and older can join in to help.\n\nAfter the treehouse is fully built, Sims with enough Handiness Skill can upgrade it with fun additions like a slide or bell. Child Sims can also redecorate the treehouse to match their interests.

Objects that are able to be placed on the balcony of a built treehouse can be found by searching for Placeable on Treehouse in the Build Mode catalog. These objects include children's toys, some instruments, activity tables, and more! Due to space constraints, certain objects will only fit onto certain parts of the treehouse balcony.

Hopewell Hills is a cozy spot away from the hustle and bustle of town; the perfect place for anyone who wants, well, space! If the suburbs are your idea of paradise, you've found it here in this quiet neighborhood.

Gilbert Gardens' gorgeous park was once owned by Gilbert Gilberts, a land developer who helped establish the area. Now, it's the perfect locale for family trips to the gardens—where, amongst other activities, Sims can take a walk on one of the three scenic lake walking paths or visit the community's Splash Pad play area. Whalebert is hoping to see you soon!

Once the center of a bustling fishing and canning industry, Anchorpoint Wharf is known now as a vibrant area downtown featuring a movie theater, parklets, and more. There's plenty to keep all ages entertained.
